summary.title: Bedrohungsmodell - OTT Auth
summary.description: Die Firma Allsecure betreibt unterschiedliche Anwendungen mit Hilfe einer 2-Faktorauthentifizierung via One-time token, der an das entsprechende Smartphone des Nutzers geschickt wird.

data.name:
Login System -
Webapp +
Mobile App
data.description: Vergleicht eingegebenen OTT-Wert auf Telefon mit erwartetem OTT seitens 2-Faktor-Dienst.

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description:
Ein DDoS Angriff kann den Login-Dienst überlasten und somit für Anwender unerreichbar machen. 

CAPEC-125: Flooding: An adversary consumes the resources of a target by rapidly engaging in a large number of interactions with the target.

ATT&CK: TA0038 - Network Effects: The adversary is trying to intercept or manipulate network traffic to or from a device.

D: 8 / R: 10 / E: 8 / A: 10 / DREA: 36
threats.mitigation:
Firewall, Load-Balancer oder CDN einsetzen, um direkten Datenverkehr auf Login-Server zu begrenzen.

DEFEND: D3-ITF - Inbound Traffic Filtering
ASVS: CWE 770 (8.1.4): Verify the application can detect and alert on abnormal numbers of requests, such as by IP, user, total per hour or day, or whatever makes sense for the application.

D: 4 / R: 10 / E: 4 / A: 10 / Neuer DREA: 28

data.name:
Externer Service für T
elefonnummernauflö
sung
Report (weekly)
data.description: wöchentlicher Report per E-Mail (signiert und verschlüsselt)

threats.title: Manipulating the report
threats.description:
Attacker could manipulate the data in SIEM-system, before it gets signed and crypted. Other option could be that attacker gets the keys to encrypt and manipulate the data.
Man in the middle
CAPEC-94: Adversary in the Middle (AiTM) https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/94.html
threats.mitigation:
Protocol Metadata Anomaly Detection
D3-PMAD
Detect anomaly within metadatas/timestamps, datasizes, missing signatures etc. 

D: 10
R: 8
E: 6
A: 9

threats.title: Login via stolen credentials
threats.description:
Attacker gets somehow login credentials example trough pishing-mails and login with its credentials. 
CAPED ID: 98 Phising https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/98.html
D: 6
R: 6
E: 7
A: 1

20/4 = 5
threats.mitigation:
MASVS-AUTH-1
Authentication and authorization 

Force 2FA on all users to prevent attackers login with stolen credentials. 

D: 6
R: 6
E: 7
A: 1

20/4 = 5

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description:
Ein DDoS Angriff kann den Login-Dienst überlasten und somit für Anwender unerreichbar machen. 

CAPEC-125: Flooding: An adversary consumes the resources of a target by rapidly engaging in a large number of interactions with the target.

ATT&CK: TA0038 - Network Effects: The adversary is trying to intercept or manipulate network traffic to or from a device.

D: 8 / R: 10 / E: 8 / A: 10 / DREA: 36
threats.mitigation:
Firewall, Load-Balancer oder CDN einsetzen, um direkten Datenverkehr auf Login-Server zu begrenzen.

DEFEND: D3-ITF - Inbound Traffic Filtering
ASVS: CWE 770 (8.1.4): Verify the application can detect and alert on abnormal numbers of requests, such as by IP, user, total per hour or day, or whatever makes sense for the application.

D: 4 / R: 10 / E: 4 / A: 10 / Neuer DREA: 28

threats.title: Authentication Bypass
threats.description:
Bypass an authentication trough links to get to secured sites
CAPEC ID: 115 Authentication Bypass https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/115.html
CAPEC ID: 151 Identity Spoofing https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/151.html
threats.mitigation:
MFA to enforce multiple authentications, makes it more difficult for attackers to bypass trough second-links or other attempts to bypass.

D3-MFA
https://d3fend.mitre.org/technique/d3f:Multi-factorAuthentication/ 

D: 4
R: 7
E: 6
A: 2

threats.title: API Request flooding
threats.description:
An attacker can flood the external service with requests where the external service can denial the requests for security reasons.
 CAPEC-469: HTTP DoS https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/469.html
CAPEC-482: TCP Flood
CAPEC-489: SSL Flood
and other protocol Floods..
threats.mitigation:
Web application firewall can filter, monitor and block traffic
id: d3f:WebApplicationFirewall  (WAF)

D: 8
R: 9
E: 6
A: 10

threats.title: attacker steals data
threats.description:
An attacker can get entry trough SQL-Injection and steal all Data, OTT-tokens, telefon numbers etc.
CAPEC-150: Collect Data from Common Resource Locations https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/150.html
CAPEC-66: SQL Injection https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/66.html
threats.mitigation:
File Encryption
D3-FE
Encryp sensitive files or tokens etc..

Secure Coding and Architecture
ASVS V15 
make pipelines injectionproof

D: 10
R: 7
E: 8
A: 10

data.name:
Externer Service für T
elefonnummernauflö
sung

Allsecure 
hauseigener
OTT Service
data.description: ein Service für die 2-Faktor-Authentifizierung mittels Telefonnummer und One-Time-Token

threats.title: manipulating functionality
threats.description:
Attacker manipulates the functionality so the OTT once was approved can be set as not approved afterwards or can set its own signing certificate as trust for legitimate certification authority
CAPEC-459: Creating a Rogue Certification Authority Certificate https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/459.html
threats.mitigation:
Check communication/TLS, accept only trustworthy roots 
ASVS V10

D: 8
R: 6
E: 6
A: 10

threats.title: code manipulation
threats.description:
An attacker can attack trough unpatched vulnerability to elevate himself to highest authorization and manipulate/inject code.
CAPEC-69: Target Programs with Elevated Privileges https://capec.mitre.org/data/definitions/69.html
threats.mitigation:
Application-based Process Isolation
D3-ABPI

Isolate the application from accessing critical/not-needed processes/infos/memory

D: 10
R: 9
E: 7
A: 10
